1 #ifndef HALIDE_CODEGEN_INTERNAL_H
2 #define HALIDE_CODEGEN_INTERNAL_H
3 
4 /** \file
5  *
6  * Defines functionality that's useful to multiple target-specific
7  * CodeGen paths, but shouldn't live in CodeGen_LLVM.h (because that's the
8  * front-end-facing interface to CodeGen).
9  */

40 /** The llvm type of a struct containing all of the externally referenced state of a Closure. */
41 llvm::StructType *build_closure_type(const Closure &closure, llvm::StructType *halide_buffer_t_type, llvm::LLVMContext *context);
42 
43 /** Emit code that builds a struct containing all the externally
44  * referenced state. Requires you to pass it a type and struct to fill in,
45  * a scope to retrieve the llvm values from and a builder to place
46  * the packing code. */
47 void pack_closure(llvm::StructType *type,
48  llvm::Value *dst,
49  const Closure &closure,
50  const Scope<llvm::Value *> &src,
51  llvm::StructType *halide_buffer_t_type,
52  llvm::IRBuilder<llvm::ConstantFolder, llvm::IRBuilderDefaultInserter> *builder);
53 
54 /** Emit code that unpacks a struct containing all the externally
55  * referenced state into a symbol table. Requires you to pass it a
56  * state struct type and value, a scope to fill, and a builder to place the
57  * unpacking code. */
58 void unpack_closure(const Closure &closure,
59  Scope<llvm::Value *> &dst,
60  llvm::StructType *type,
61  llvm::Value *src,
62  llvm::IRBuilder<llvm::ConstantFolder, llvm::IRBuilderDefaultInserter> *builder);

86 /** Given a size (in bytes), return True if the allocation size can fit
87  * on the stack; otherwise, return False. This routine asserts if size is
88  * non-positive. */
89 bool can_allocation_fit_on_stack(int64_t size);
90 
91 /** Does a {div/mod}_round_to_zero using binary long division for int/uint.
92  * max_abs is the maximum absolute value of (a/b).
93  * Returns the pair {div_round_to_zero, mod_round_to_zero}. */
94 std::pair<Expr, Expr> long_div_mod_round_to_zero(const Expr &a, const Expr &b,
95  const uint64_t *max_abs = nullptr);
96 
97 /** Given a Halide Euclidean division/mod operation, do constant optimizations
98  * and possibly call lower_euclidean_div/lower_euclidean_mod if necessary.
99  * Can introduce mulhi_shr and sorted_avg intrinsics as well as those from the
100  * lower_euclidean_ operation -- div_round_to_zero or mod_round_to_zero. */
101 ///@{
102 Expr lower_int_uint_div(const Expr &a, const Expr &b);
103 Expr lower_int_uint_mod(const Expr &a, const Expr &b);
104 ///@}
105 
106 /** Given a Halide Euclidean division/mod operation, define it in terms of
107  * div_round_to_zero or mod_round_to_zero. */
108 ///@{
109 Expr lower_euclidean_div(Expr a, Expr b);
110 Expr lower_euclidean_mod(Expr a, Expr b);
111 ///@}
112 
113 /** Given a Halide shift operation with a signed shift amount (may be negative), define
114  * an equivalent expression using only shifts by unsigned amounts. */
115 ///@{
116 Expr lower_signed_shift_left(const Expr &a, const Expr &b);
117 Expr lower_signed_shift_right(const Expr &a, const Expr &b);
118 ///@}
119 
120 /** Reduce a mux intrinsic to a select tree */
121 Expr lower_mux(const Call *mux);
122 
123 /** Given an llvm::Module, set llvm:TargetOptions, cpu and attr information */
124 void get_target_options(const llvm::Module &module, llvm::TargetOptions &options, std::string &mcpu, std::string &mattrs);
125 
126 /** Given two llvm::Modules, clone target options from one to the other */
127 void clone_target_options(const llvm::Module &from, llvm::Module &to);
128 
129 /** Given an llvm::Module, get or create an llvm:TargetMachine */
130 std::unique_ptr<llvm::TargetMachine> make_target_machine(const llvm::Module &module);
131 
132 /** Set the appropriate llvm Function attributes given a Target. */
133 void set_function_attributes_for_target(llvm::Function *, const Target &);
134 
135 /** Save a copy of the llvm IR currently represented by the module as
136  * data in the __LLVM,__bitcode section. Emulates clang's
137  * -fembed-bitcode flag and is useful to satisfy Apple's bitcode
138  * inclusion requirements. */
139 void embed_bitcode(llvm::Module *M, const std::string &halide_command);
